item.title: Rubbish at bottom of Boundary Road, 8th February
item.description:
Rubbish everywhere from number 1 Boundary Road. Fast food containers, alcohol tins, glass and general rubbish on the pavement and in the road. This is an eyesore, encouraging in vermin and foxes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Boundary Road, Falconwood, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking bays, 8th February
item.description:
This photo is of 3 parking bays opposite 10 Buttermere road which are owned by certain houses as per the deeds, e.g. the bay on the right belongs to number 10, as there are no markings or signage any member of the public park and leave their vehicle there for days. We require either markings with the door number or signage stating private parking. According to other residents the bays did have markings but wore off a while ago and was never replaced. Thank you for your consideration.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Buttermere Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on pavement and road, 8th February
item.description:
There is rubbish everywhere at the bottom of Boundary Road- from number 1 up to Blair Close. The rubbish is everywhere, alcohol tins shoved behind a lamppost, rubbish in the road, broken glass, fast food packaging on the pavement. This is encouraging vermin, rodents and foxes to the road. Some of the rubbish looks like it has come out of an overflowing skip at number 2 Boundary Road. This has been ongoing for months and is an eyesore and health and safety issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Boundary Road, Falconwood, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Maley Avenue SE27 opposite side of the road to h, 8th February
item.description:
